member.name: T:Vector.Diagnostics.DfwApiFacadeProvider
member.summary: This static class is used as store for an object that implements . The via the static Adapter property provided instance is used by the VDS implementation to access the native implementation (the Vector Diagnostics Internal - VDI - API).

member.summary: Member for the used implementation (adapter to access the VDI API).
member.remarks: This member was not declared as volatile by design: to reduce performance impacts.

member.name: P:Vector.Diagnostics.DfwApiFacadeProvider.Adapter
member.summary: Gets or sets the adapter that implements IDfwApiWrapper.
member.remarks: The property is not thread safe so in a multi threaded environment the user code has to ensure that the adapter is provided, before other threads request the adapter by appropriate synchronization. The reason not using locks inside the adapter are performance requirements by environments like CANoe.

member.name: T:Vector.Diagnostics.Application
member.summary: The Application is the starting point for each script. The Application class has access to the loaded ECUs of the scripting host via the application 'environment' (i.e. CANape, CANoe, etc.; e.g. Write window, CANape device or CANoe target, ...).

member.name: M:Vector.Diagnostics.Application.GetEcu
member.summary: Get access to the ECU that is provided (by the application) for the current execution context.
member.returns: The Ecu object if there is one defined for the current execution context, null otherwise.

member.name: M:Vector.Diagnostics.Application.GetEcu(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the ECU with the given qualifier.
member.returns: The ECU object if it exists, null otherwise.
member.remarks:
NOTES:
This method enables access to an already configured ECU of the host application. (The configuration includes the variant selection.)
A qualifier can be assigned to an ECU in the application (e.g. in CANoe, CANape), therefore there is no guarantee that different applications know the ECU under the same qualifier.

member.returns: A readonly collection that contains the available ECU qualifiers.

member.name: T:Vector.Diagnostics.Ecu
member.summary: The ECU represents a diagnostics server. Each ECU references a diagnostics description that defines the diagnostics services. Within the application the communication channel is configured to allow access to the ECU via a network.
member.remarks: The ECU has to be configured in the host application.

The resources that are held for messages (requests and responses) have to be cleared after the according objects will not be accessed any more. This has to be done by calling the Dispose() method of such objects or by using the the C# 'using' statement. To assure that all (of the possibly multiple) responses of a service communication transaction are cleared, call the Dispose() method of the SendResult object.

member.summary: Internal interface of the class.
member.remarks: Not part of the official VDS interface.

member.name: P:Vector.Diagnostics.ISendResult.Response
member.summary: The response to the sent request message (if available; null otherwise). In case of multiple responses are to be expected or possible for a certain request (e.g. multiple responses or functional requests) then the Responses property will provide the list of responses (i.e. this Response property will return null).
member.value: The response.
member.remarks: The response message might be null if an error occurred. Please check the Status-property for the value "OK" before accessing the response message.

member.name: P:Vector.Diagnostics.ISendResult.Responses
member.summary: Gets the list of response messages from the ECU.
member.remarks: In the special case that several responses may be received for a single request sent (e.g. GM fault memory access with multiple responses or the responses belonging to a functional request) the response collection can be accessed using this 'Responses' container property. Notice that the 'Responses' property has always to be used for multiple response services, even if only one response is received; e.g. if there is only one DTC or if only one ECU did respond to a functional request.

member.name: P:Vector.Diagnostics.ISendResult.Status
member.summary: Gets the status of the request message transmission.

member.name: T:Vector.Diagnostics.Request
member.summary: Provides a diagnostic request message.
member.remarks: The resources that are held for messages (requests and responses) have to be cleared after the according objects will not be accessed any more. This has to be done by calling the Dispose() method of such objects. C# comes with an extra statement which is built in in the language: using. With this keyword one can define a scope, outside of which an object will automatically be disposed.

member.name: T:Vector.Diagnostics.Response
member.summary: Provides a diagnostic response message.
member.remarks: The resources that are held for messages (requests and responses) have to be cleared after the corresponding objects will not be accessed any more. This has to be done by calling the Dispose() method of such objects. C# comes with an extra statement which is built in in the language: using. With this keyword one can define a scope, outside of which an object will automatically be disposed.

member.summary: Contains the result of unlock an ECU using and .

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.SecurityAccessResult.NoResult
member.summary: The current state of unlock an ECU is unknown (initial state).

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.SecurityAccessResult.Success
member.summary: Unlock an ECU in the specified level was successful.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.SecurityAccessResult.InvalidSeedKeyDll
member.summary: The seed and key DLL was not configured or could not be used.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.SecurityAccessResult.CommunicationError
member.summary: A communication error occurred when unlocking the ECU.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.SecurityAccessResult.NegativeResponse
member.summary: The ECU to be unlocked responds with a negative response code (NRC). Check trace window for further details.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.SecurityAccessResult.Failure
member.summary: Unlocking the ECU failed because of an unspecified error. See write window or log file for further details.

member.name: T:Vector.Diagnostics.SendStatus
member.summary: The request transmission result states.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.SendStatus.Ok
member.summary: Sending data to the ECU succeeded.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.SendStatus.InvalidRequest
member.summary: Invalid request specified.
member.remarks: No response is available.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.SendStatus.CommunicationError
member.summary: Communication error occurred (either sending the request or receiving the response).
member.remarks: No response is available.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.SendStatus.FailedResponseParse
member.summary: One (or more) responses received that do not match the definitions.
member.remarks: No response is available.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.SendStatus.UnexpectedResponse
member.summary: One or more responses received while no or just a single response was expected.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.SendStatus.AsynchronousTransactionPending
member.summary: Needed for asynchronous communication: No response information available yet. I.e. (final) response not received and also no error detected by now.

member.name: T:Vector.Diagnostics.WaitResult
member.summary: The result codes of a waiting operation.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.WaitResult.Aborted
member.summary: Waiting operation aborted, i.e. SendResult is not available.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.WaitResult.Timeout
member.summary: Timeout occurred during wait operation. In TimeOut case no responses were received, i.e. the transaction is not completed yet and therefore the SendResult object does not contain any responses.

member.name: F:Vector.Diagnostics.WaitResult.Success
member.summary: Wait operation was successful, i.e. the transaction is completed and the SendResult object contains the responses.

member.name: T:Vector.Diagnostics.SendResult
member.summary: The result of the service communication transaction. Contains the transaction status (e.g. error state) and the response object if available.
member.remarks: To assure that all (of the possibly multiple) responses of a service communication transaction are cleared, call the Dispose() method of the SendResult object when the responses will not be accessed any more.

member.name: P:Vector.Diagnostics.SendResult.Status
member.summary: Gets the status of the request message transmission.

member.name: P:Vector.Diagnostics.SendResult.Response
member.summary: The response to the sent request message (if available; null otherwise). In case of multiple responses are to be expected or possible for a certain request (e.g. multiple responses or functional requests) then the Responses property will provide the list of responses (i.e. this Response property will return null).
member.remarks: The response message might be null if an error occurred. Please check the Status-property for the value "OK" before accessing the response message.

member.name: P:Vector.Diagnostics.SendResult.Responses
member.summary: Gets the list of response messages from the ECU.
member.remarks: In the special case that several responses may be received for a single request sent (e.g. GM fault memory access with multiple responses or the responses belonging to a functional request) the response collection can be accessed using this 'Responses' container property. Notice that the 'Responses' property has always to be used for multiple response services, even if only one response is received; e.g. if there is only one DTC or if only one ECU did respond to a functional request.

member.summary: Either waits for all results to complete or a timeout to occur.
member.param: The timeout in milliseconds. In case timeout is < 0 no timeout shall occur. In case timeout == 0 the method shall return immediately, indicating either Success in case the result was already available when the method was called or Aborted/Timeout otherwise.
member.returns: A WaitResult value indicating the exact outcome of the waiting operation.

member.name: M:Vector.Diagnostics.SendResult.WaitAll(Vector.Diagnostics.SendResult[])

The index of the result that completed.
member.returns: A WaitResult value indicating the exact outcome of the waiting operation.

member.summary: Waits for one of the results to complete.
